intro: Misanteca cayennensis, commonly known as the Cayenne mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Loranthaceae family. It grows on the branches of various host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its berries are typically red or orange, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. The botanical characteristics of Misanteca cayennensis make it an important part of the ecological interactions within its native habitats.
